headline.main: PRAGUE POISONING CHARGED BY NAZIS; Friendly Editors Are Said to Be Victims of Enemies of Moves for Collaboration

lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Oct. 11 (AP) -- D.N.B., the official news agency, reported today that Karl Laznowsky, editor in-chief of Ceske Slovo, Prague newspaper, had died and that several other Czecho-Slovak editors friendly to Germany were ill as a result of poisoning.
abstract: executions and arrests of alleged Communists reptd, Croatia
